intro: Silene sargentii, commonly known as Sargent's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, with five petals and numerous stamens, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Silene sargentii is often found in meadows and open slopes at high elevations.
